page.title: 10Commerce in N.E.Mynd Area
page.content: In Leebotwood can be found the only public house,the Pound.This started life as a farmhouse in the 15th Century.The farmer's wife brewed ale, and drovers,on their long trek across the Longmynd to markets in the south, made this a regular stopping place.In the 18th Century the bar was used as a courtroom and felons were placed in the stocks in the village pound,hence the name.Business grew and now the inn provides modern day hospitality with bar snacks,meals in a small dining room and accommodation on a Bed & Breakfast basis. The small general store began as a baker's shop more than one hundred years ago and there has been a Post Office in the village since 1840.There is a large Pick Your Own fruit farm and several smaller farms sell eggs, fruit, plants and vegetables.
